trans-unit.source: Get All Jobs (Scheduler API)
trans-unit.target: Get All Jobs (Scheduler API)

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get All Jobs</languageKeyword> operation gets all the jobs in a job collection.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get All Jobs</languageKeyword> operation gets all the jobs in a job collection.

trans-unit.source: The full list of jobs can be accessed by excluding any job ID in the GET call (i.e. /jobs.)
trans-unit.target: The full list of jobs can be accessed by excluding any job ID in the GET call (i.e. /jobs.)

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Get All Jobs</languageKeyword> request is specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Get All Jobs</languageKeyword> request is specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloud-service-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your cloud service ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;job-collection-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the ID of the job collection, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;job-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the ID of the job.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloud-service-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your cloud service ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;job-collection-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the ID of the job collection, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;job-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the ID of the job.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: GET
trans-unit.target: GET

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: To fetch all jobs of a particular state, you can provide a query parameter defining the jobs you are interested in (e.g. enabled, disabled, completed, faulted).
trans-unit.target: To fetch all jobs of a particular state, you can provide a query parameter defining the jobs you are interested in (e.g. enabled, disabled, completed, faulted).

trans-unit.source: For example, to retrieve all jobs that are completed, you would call <codeInline>GET /jobs?$filter=state%20eq%20completed</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: For example, to retrieve all jobs that are completed, you would call <codeInline>GET /jobs?$filter=state%20eq%20completed</codeInline>

trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: This header should be set to <userInput>2013-06-01</userInput> or a later version.
trans-unit.target: This header should be set to <userInput>2013-06-01</userInput> or a later version.

trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the Management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the Management service.

trans-unit.source: For an asynchronous operation, you can call get operation status with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.
trans-unit.target: For an asynchronous operation, you can call get operation status with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.
